title: Here’s how many people visited Salem this past Halloween
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Salem welcomed 96,000 visitors on Halloween Day 2025, a 7.2% increase from the previous year.
Throughout October 2025, 1.1 million unique visitors came to Salem, matching the record from the previous year.
Despite challenges like rain and a government shutdown, total visitor numbers were 1.4 million, a 6.3% decrease from last year.

title: Whitey Bulger mugshot comes down at Savin Hill restaurant after backlash
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Savin Bar and Kitchen removed Whitey Bulger's mugshot after backlash from local residents and national media attention.
The controversial mugshots were linked to recent renovations following the restaurant's feature on Gordon Ramsay's 'Secret Service' show.
Local criticism centered on the insensitivity of displaying mobsters' images, with strong opposition from the Columbia-Savin Hill Civic Association.

title: Have you seen snowliage — that wild mix of fall leaves and winter snow?
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Snowliage is a rare natural phenomenon where autumn foliage and early snowfall combine, recently observed in Vermont.
Photographer Phil Bobrow captured snowliage images in Vermont, highlighting vibrant leaves covered with snow in higher elevations.
Vermonters share snowliage sightings on social media, emphasizing the unique beauty and rarity of this seasonal overlap.

title: Lynn man convicted of killing girlfriend whose body was found in Saugus marsh
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Bruce Maiben, 48, of Lynn, was convicted of first-degree murder in Sherell Pringle's 2021 death in Saugus marsh.
Judge Thomas Drechsler sentenced Maiben to life in prison without parole, sending him to Souza-Baranowski Correctional Center.
Authorities arrested Maiben after Pringle went missing, later charging him with murder amid evidence of his threatening behavior.

title: Debt holders take over downtown Boston office building sold below value
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: The five-story office building at 99 Bedford St., Boston, sold for $19 million at auction, below assessed value.
Chevron Partners LLC and Capital Hall Partners acquired the building with plans to renovate and maintain it as office space.
The City of Boston, runner-up bidder, aimed to convert the building to housing, aligning with its office-to-residential initiative.

title: Bruins’ Fraser Minten is starting to see his stock rise in Marco Sturm’s system
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Fraser Minten has averaged over 15 minutes of ice time, scoring four points in his last five games.
Bruins' Fraser Minten was promoted to a top line with David Pastrnak and Marat Khusnutdinov against the Islanders.
Minten's defensive efforts included 2:27 of shorthanded ice time, contributing to a perfect 3-for-3 penalty kill performance.

title: All the new movies and TV shows streaming in November
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Stranger Things' Season 5 debuts on November 26 on Netflix as part of new November releases.
HBO Max features Chris Evans romcom 'Materialists' and Ari Aster's 'Eddington' in November.
Disney+ streams 'Fantastic Four: First Steps' on November 5 as part of its November lineup.

title: Tom Brady refuses to pick sides in Patriots Buccaneers matchup
author: Aidan Buchanan
bullets: Tom Brady avoids picking sides as his former teams, Patriots and Buccaneers, prepare to face off this Sunday.
Both teams are performing well, Patriots at 7-2 and Buccaneers at 6-2, leading their divisions.
Brady praises Patriots' performance, dubbing it 'The Vrabel Way' after their recent victory against the Falcons.

title: South Shore woman loses over $30,000 in arrest warrant scam
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: A Weymouth woman lost $31,600 in an arrest warrant scam, per Norfolk County Sheriff's Office.
The woman made payments to the scammer via wire transfer and Apple Pay over two days.
Norfolk County Sheriff advises reporting such calls to police and warns against sharing personal information.

title: 29-year-old driver killed in crash that closed Route 1 Wednesday morning
author: John Waller
bullets: A 29-year-old driver died in a crash on Route 1 in Norwood, closing the road before 8 a.m. Wednesday.
The other involved driver, a 47-year-old man, was hospitalized with non-life-threatening injuries.
Route 1 reopened shortly after 11 a.m.; the crash investigation is ongoing.
